newsitem.title: USA: PepsiCo international beverage volume down.
newsitem.headline: PepsiCo international beverage volume down.

text.p: PepsiCo Inc said Tuesday its international beverage volume fell nine percent in the 1996 fourth quarter and two percent for the full year.
Roger Enrico, chairman and chief executive officer, described the declines as "dramatic."
He said the losses stemmed in part from an accumulation of unproductive investments in markets and in beverage-related activities outside the company's core business.
PepsiCo officials were not available for further comment.
The company, reporting lower earnings from on-going operations for the 1996 fourth quarter and full year, said its international beverage operations are measured in bottled case sales (BCS).
It said it lost $404 million in its international beverage operations for the fourth quarter, compared with a loss of $3 million a year earlier.

PepsiCo said the international beverage losses included higher than normal expenses of about $80 million from fourth-quarter balance sheet readjustments, as well as unusual charges of $186 million related to restructuring.
The company said its Pepsi-Cola North America operations reported a 14 percent profit rise for 1996 on a four percent rise in sales.
It said its Frito-Lay North America operations reported a 12 percent profit rise in 1996 on a 13 percent sales rise.
PepsiCo said its restaurant operations had a sales decline of one percent for 1996 and two percent for the fourth quarter.
The company said earlier this month it would spin off the $11 billion worth of restaurant operations.
PepsiCo shares were off 7/8 at 33-1/4 in early trading.
